page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {LOCAL HISTORY} Mr.Anstey has lived at Little Llangoven Farm most of his life and witnessed many changes.He described vividly the village school he attended in Raglan at the beginning of the century.As a boy he walked every morning across the meadows.Children who acted the fool in school would almost certainly be dealt with severely,the headmaster has no qualms about making any hand bleed.At secondary school age Mr.Anstey went to Monmouth,catching a train every morning at Dingestow. Until he owned a motor bike in 1924 the trains were a life line for Mr.Anstey and this rural community.Traffic was so scarce Mr. Anstey would drive sheep to market in Abergavenny without meeting a car.
